docblock.description: Stores system's log Configuration example for systemlog.config.php: $systemLogConfig = [ "errorsToLog" => [ // An array of strings of the class names corresponding to the system log event types that must be logged "SystemLogEvenInfo", "SystemLogEvenWarning", "SystemLogEvenError", "SystemLogEvenCritical", "SystemLogEvenHack" ], "databaseProviderName" => "main", // The name of the database provider where the system log table is found "tableName" => "cherrycake_systemLog" // The name of the table, defaulted to this "cacheProviderName" => "huge", // The name of the cache provider that will be used to temporally store log events as they happen, to be later added to the database by the JanitorTaskSystemLog "cacheKeyUniqueId" => "QueuedSystemLogEvents", // The unique cache key to use when storing events into cache. Defaults to "QueuedSystemLogEvents" "isQueueInCache" => true, // Whether to store the log events into cache (queue it) in order to be later processed by JanitorTaskSystemLog, or directly store it on the database. Defaults to true. ];

var.description: $isConfig Sets whether this module has its own configuration file. Defaults to false.
$dependentCherrycakeModules Cherrycake module names that are required by this module

docblock.description: Initializes the module and sets the PHP error level

return.description: Whether the module has been initted ok
Whether the event has been logged or not

description.compact: Stores the given SystemLogEvent into cache (queues it) in order to be later processed by JanitorTaskSystemLog

param.description: The system log event to queue

return.description: Whether the system log event could be queued or not

description.compact: Stores the cached system log events into the database, should be called periodically, normally via a JanitorTask

return.description: An array where the first key is a boolean indicating wether the opeartion went ok or not, and the second key is an optional hash array containing detailed information about the operation done.
The cache key to use when retrieveing and storing cache items
An array where the first element is a boolean indicating wether the operation went ok or not, and the second element is a description of what happened.

description.compact: Get the log in HTML format This method expects that the engine has been loaded with the following modules: * Database * Ui * UiComponentTable

var.description: $isConfig Sets whether this module has its own configuration file. Defaults to false.
$config Holds the default configuration for this module
$dependentCherrycakeModules Cherrycake module names that are required by this module
$dependentAppModules App module names that are required by this module

docblock.description: Loads the configuration file for this module, if there's one

param.description: An array of configuration options for this module. It merges them with the hard coded default values configured in the overloaded module.

return.description: The value of the specified config key. Returns false if doesn't exists.

param.description: The configuration key, or a hash array of keys => values if multiple keys are to be changed

docblock.description: Loads the dependent modules required by this one

return.description: Whether the dependent modules were loaded ok

docblock.description: Maps the Actions to which this module must respond. Should be overloaded by a module class when needed. Intended to contain calls to self::mapAction()
Adds the Css/Javascript files/code needed by this module to the proper set on Css and Javascript modules.

Initializes the module, intended to be overloaded. Called when the module is loaded. Contains any specific initializations for the module, and any required loading of modules and classes dependencies.

return.description: Whether the module has been loaded ok

docblock.description: Joins two arrays like PHP function array_merge_recursive_distinct does, but instead it does not adds elements to arrays when keys match: it replaces them.
